body:
I respectfully disagree.

On the objective : i thought this proposal was about facilitating refactoring, not shortening permanent code.

On the proposal: this objective ambiguity illustrate that this proposal allows to open many doors. Many people here seem to agree with one but not the others. Voting yes on the proposal will open all of them.

On this second door (objective) of shortening permanent code:

Readability is about mental indirections, before being about code lengths.

If i am forced to choose, i prefer code that is 20% longer with 20% less mental indirections than the opposite. Plus, 20% longer code often requires 20% less documentation to explain it

This is a after having believed for 20 years in abstractions, smart & efficient code, etc...

Ps : having less operators in the language and less indirections has a parallel, its called sparsity in machine learning, and is a big predictor of a model robustness

Raphael

> Le 27 juil 2016 à 12:18, Gustavo Niemeyer <notifications@github.com> a écrit :
> Note that the var p.V and import p.V syntax closes the door to some day having a way to alias built in types. This is useful to using bulky type names without having to type all of it every single time, and without introducing a local type just to have a shorter "alias" as is commonly done today.
